name: places/ChIJjwnVQZZYwokRmprbva7ExN0
formattedAddress: 1078 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1078 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10028-0237, USA

originalText.text:
I feel like I need to throw my hat in the ring here. I first went to iris nails a few years ago. I stumbled upon it. I don’t do color in anyway, so perhaps that had something to do with it, but it was one of the best pedicures and manicures I’d ever received. Shout out to my girl Esther. And Joy’s massage is phenomenal.

The environment is clean quiet and beautiful. Better than 90% of the nail salons in the city.
Yes. It is very very expensive. But like…it’s a bougie nail salon on Madison Avenue. I’m not really sure why this is inspiring such shock? I spend legit like $220 every time I’m there but it’s what I sign up for and I really like the end result and the experience during.

originalText.text:
I wish I could leave one star. DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!!!! absolute scam of a place.
My nail tech left me sitting for 15-20 minutes at a time as she took care of checking people out. I got a powder manicure and my total was $170! INSANE! I have been going to local nail salons surrounding Iris for years and a powder manicure is always between $60-75 TOTAL.
They then harassed me for a tip and I told them there was no way I was tipping on top of an extraordinary price already.
Also, my manicure is horrible quality. There is polish all over my hands, the powder is not sealed on the edges, and she broke three nails in the process and had to take all of my length off.

DONT GO

originalText.text: DO NOT GO HERE! This place is an absolute scam. I went for a full body massage and ended up getting a glorified foot massage. The person who did the massage insisted that this was indeed a full body massage and I was charged $170 for a foot massage. When I complained after I was offered a $10 refund. Cheap, scammy place.

The person who did the massage insisted that this was indeed a full body massage and I was charged $170 for a foot massage. When I complained after I was offered a $10 refund. Cheap, scammy place.

originalText.text: This was one of the best manicures I’ve ever had in NYC, so I am really happy with it (I had it an hour ago so we’ll see!), however I couldn’t believe when I got the bill - $83 for a gel manicure. Whoa. So I’m sad I just had a great manicure, but sadly I don’t think I can justify spending that much on a manicure.

text.text: This was one of the best manicures I’ve ever had in NYC, so I am really happy with it (I had it an hour ago so we’ll see!), however I couldn’t believe when I got the bill - $83 for a gel manicure. Whoa. So I’m sad I just had a great manicure, but sadly I don’t think I can justify spending that much on a manicure.

originalText.text: I was deeply, deeply, deeply disappointed in my experience at this salon. I got nail extensions here less then 2 weeks ago, and right off at the bat noticed something amiss about the way that they go about their nail extensions. In lieu of using the plastic tips that I am used to getting applied at different nail salons, they used a technique that involved some form of gel substance pondering me to question the security and quality of my nail extensions. Not only was this set a wopping 175 dollars, but it isn’t even like I got some design to make it so expensive. At any other place, they would have been $100 including tip. Not to mention, I’m not a very active person and my middle finger nail chipped off after doing absolutely nothing to provoke it. A few days later the pinky nail tip broke off as well; for paying $18 per nail (which is already absurd) the nails should not be coming off with such ease. I will never come back here again and I suggest that no one even steps foot here.
